data.title: Royal families in Germany
data.meta_description: Royal families in Germany and their history, geschichte
data.text:
The first King of Belgium was Leopold I. He came from the family

'Saxe-Coburg and Gotha'. Many European Royal Families are linked to this House.

So, I started to interest me in the history of German Royal - and noble families.

If you have suggestions, tips or comments feel free to post them!

Der erste König von Belgien war Leopold I. Er stammte aus der Familie

'Sachsen Coburg und Gotha'.Viele Europaïsche Königshäuser sind zu dieser

Dynastie verbunden. So fing ich an, mich in der Geschichte der

Deutschen Königlichen- und Adelsfamilien zu interessieren.

Wenn Sie Anregungen oder Tipps haben, zögern Sie nicht, mich zu kontaktieren.

Kingdoms

Bavaria (in German: Bayern)

House of Wittelsbach

Source picture: Wikipedia

The capital of Bavaria is Munich with a lot of amazing castles like

Munich Residenz

The Residenz - a pleasant surprise after those walls

Nymphenburg Castle in Munich

1806 -1825 : Maximilian I

Born: 1756

Died: 1825

1st. Marriage: Augusta Wilhelmine of Hesse Darmstadt

Children:

* Ludwig I, who married Therese of Saxe-Hildburghausen

* Augusta Amalia Ludovika Georgia - who married

Eugène de Bauharnais - on this link

* Amalie Marie Auguste, who died in infancy

* Caroline Auguste, who married William, Crown Prince of Württemberg

and secondly Francis I of Austria - on this link

* Karl Theodor Maximilian Auguste

2nd Marriage: Friederike Karoline Wilhelmine of Baden

Children:

* Stilborn son

* Maximilian Joseph Karl Friedrich

* Elisabeth Ludovika and queen consort of Prussia - on this link

* Amalie Auguste, queen consort of Saxony - on this link

* Sophie, Archduchess of Austria - on this link

* Marie Anne Leopoldine Elisabeth Wilhelmine, who married

Frederick Augustus II of Saxony

* Ludovika - mother of Sisi - on this Link 1

* Maximiliana Josepha Caroline , who died in infancy

I made a Weekend Special about him & a Today in History.

Check these links too:

on this Link 2

1864-1886: Ludwig II

Born: 1845

Died: 1886

Is sometimes called 'Mad King Ludwig' or 'Swan King'

He was eccentric and interested in architecture and art.

He gave the order to build many castles. The most famous is Neuschwanstein.

Electors of Brandenburg

In early modern times Brandenburg was one of the seven electoral states

in the Holy Roman Empire. From 1415 it was governed by members of the

House of Hohenzolleren. However in 1618 the Margraviate of Brandenburg

and the Duchy of Prussia were combined as Brandenburg-Prussia.

From 1701 the state was elevated in the Kingdom of Prussia.

in German: Sachsen

Saxony is near Brandenburg, Saxony Anhalt, Thuringia, Bavaria,

Poland and the Czech Republic.

The capital of Saxony was Dresden.

Württemberg

Source picture: Wikipedia

Württemberg was bordered by Baden and Bavaria in the east.

The capital of Württemberg was Stuttgart.

The House of Württemberg, one of the ruling Houses of Germany

was famous in Europe from the 13th. century.

I made a blog post about this royal family, check this link.

Grand Duchy Hesse &

by Rhine

(1806 - 1918)

capital: Darmstadt

The Grand Duchy of Hesse and by Rhine is situated on the banks of

the Rhine. The territory of this grand duchy is much smaller than its

neighbors. These were Bavaria and Württemberg.

Because of its mild climate and its medicinal springs Hesse was

attractive to the Russian elite.

1806-1830: Louis I

Born: 1753

Died: 1830

Married:

Louise of Hesse-Darmstadt

1830-1848: Louis II

Born: 1777

Died: 1848

Married:

Wilhelmine of Baden

1848-1877: Louis III

Born: 1806

Died: 1877

Married:

Princess Mathilde Caroline of Bavaria

1877-1892: Louis IV

Born: 1837

Died: 1892

Married:

Princess Alice of the United Kingdom (daughter of Queen Victoria)

Parents of inter alia Alexandra Feodorovna &

Elisabeth Feodorovna.

Tragedy was constant in this Grand Ducal Family.

Prince Friedrich Wilhelm, the second son died after falling

from an open window in 1873.

In 1878 tragedy came again in the family. The children

caught diphtheria and Alice personally nursed her family.

The youngest daughter Marie didn't survive the epedemic.

Three weeks later Alice died, she was 35 years old.

1892-1918: Ernest Louis

Born: 1868

Died: 1918

Married:

Victoria Melita of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha (divorced)

Eleonore of Solms - Hohensolmslich

The Battenberg family was formerly a monarganic branch of the

House of Hesse-Darmstadt, rulers of the Grand Duchy of Hesse in Germany.

The first member was Julia Hauke, whose brother-in-law Grand

Duke Louis III of Hesse created her in 1851 Countess of Battenberg.

One of the members of this family was Princess Alice of Battenberg.

She married Prince Andrew of Greece and Denmark. They were the

parents of inter alia Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh.

Princess Louise of Battenberg renounced her title in 1917 and she

became Lady Louise Mountbatten. She married the future Gustaf VI

Adolf of Sweden.

Mecklenburg - Schwerin

The region of Mecklenburg was located in Northern Germany

along the Baltic Sea. It was comprised of two Grand Duchies:

Mecklenburg-Schwerin

Mecklenburg Strelitz

Royal Places of interest

Aachen

Aachen Rathaus Germany

Aachen was the favorite residence of Charlemagne. There are a lot of Historical

traces like this amazing Rathaus. Check my Happy History Weekend Picture on

this link.

Aachen Cathedral Dom Germany

The Aachen Cathedral - Check my blogpost about Royal Places on this

link.
